title: Intermittent native_tests matmul/bmm assert failure
body_html:
+ ./src/ATen/test/native_test
01:56:38 terminate called after throwing an instance of 'std::runtime_error'
01:56:38   what():  /var/lib/jenkins/workspace/aten/src/ATen/test/native_test.cpp:102: test: Assertion `d5.matmul(d1).allclose(d5.view({24, 2, 3}).bmm(d1.view({1, 3, 1}).expand({24, 3, 1})).view({3, 2, 4, 2}))` failed.
01:56:38 ../aten/tools/run_tests.sh: line 13:  6021 Aborted                 $BUILD_ROOT/src/ATen/test/native_test

Full log: https://ci.pytorch.org/jenkins/job/pytorch-builds/job/pytorch-linux-xenial-py3-clang5-asan-build/379//console

The test didn't fail on the subsequent CI run. Are we seeding the RNG correctly?

01:56:38 ../aten/tools/run_tests.sh: line 13:  6021 Aborted                 $BUILD_ROOT/src/ATen/test/native_test

Full log: https://ci.pytorch.org/jenkins/job/pytorch-builds/job/pytorch-linux-xenial-py3-clang5-asan-build/379//console
The test didn't fail on the subsequent CI run. Are we seeding the RNG correctly?
